reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spacious, clean, quiet with fantastic view over lake. We were there for a wedding nearby, and were treated well by staff. Recommended.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: First stayed here in 2002 - it was clean fresh and staff cared. What a difference time makes..... May 2008... Staff and management appear to have given up and stopped caring.
reviews.title: Hotel OK - Has gone down hill since 2002. Restaurant should be embarrassed !!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That'll do attitude all around the places but no where more noticable than then retaurant for dinner. What sort of chef or management will allow - cook from frozen Osso Bucco with a bag of truly vile sauce, frozen vegetables and to top it all instant mashed potates - It was a chemical experiment gone wrong. Lazy, plastic, no care cooking !!! The worst meal I have had in a hotel restaurant anywhere in the world after 20 years of travelling.
reviews.title: Quiet, clean, friendly, EXCELLENT option in Dallas
Dated and Stale Marriott Hotel
reviews.text: Shame on you Marriot Group - Pull your socks up please !

I was surprised to see that I did not write a review of this hotel last year when I was a guest. I'll sum up two years in this review. EXCELLENT. I am a Dallas/Ft. Worth native, and am very familiar with Irving and Las Colinas. I don't know how old this Marriott is, but it is relatively new and maybe even just a couple of years old. First, it is conveniently located off highway 114 by the famous Mustangs of Las Colinas. My fiance and I stayed there last year and this year because he was working the Thanksgiving Cowboys game, and my parents live just west of the airport. Therefore, this was a very convenient choice to the stadium, my family, friends, and plenty of restaurants. Last year, we felt like we were in The Shining because nobody was there, or so it seemed. This year, the Jets stayed at the hotel so there was a lot more activity, but still, very quiet and peaceful. The room itself is your typical Marriott room - clean, internet, comfy bed, etc. The bathroom is roomy and we had a nice size balcony overlooking the pond. It was very relaxing to sit out there, even though it was 80 degrees one minute and the next minute it had dropped to 40 degrees. There are robes in the closets, which is always impressive to me. The concierge level was closed, so they comped our breakfast for 2 days. The restaurant is big, and they have an excellent breakfast selection and buffet including lo-carb and lo-fat options. There is a bar and a nice seating area in the lobby. The workout center has treadmills, bikes, efx machines, weights, bottled water, towels, and 2 HD TV's which allowed me to watch ESPN and the Macy's Thanksgiving Day parade simultaneously. This Marriott also has a computer and printer at the front desk so that you can check in and print boarding passes on the way out the door. They have their own parking garage so there is plenty of room to park conveniently. Finally, my fiance asked for laundry service and was concerned about the holiday...no problem, they had it ready for him Thanksgiving morning. Great service, great location, and you can't beat the value you receive for the price. If you are staying in Irving or want to be close enough yet far away to downtown Dallas, TX Stadium (for one more year), or DFW airport, I would certainly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice, but somewhat stale

reviews.text: Opted to stay here for a night in July instead of Arlington (was in Texas to catch a Rangers game) and can honestly say I'm happy I did. Hotels in Arlington are no where near the caliber of this Marriott. The staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were very basic and comfortable. The view of the lake was very nice. I understand there are gondola rides at the lake but we didnt see any (maybe because the weather wasn't 100%).
reviews.title: Great Hotel..

reviews.text: Breakfast the next morning was very nice. My only complaint is the directions given to us to go to the airport were not very clear so we ended up getting lost. Thank god we left with enough time to spare otherwise we could have missed our flight.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: All in all, this is a great hotel and I'd definitely stay here again if I'm ever in the Dallas area. It's within driving distance of many things. But as another reviewer mentioned, this is purely for the business traveler. There's a mall another exit away that has places to eat, etc. Nothing within walking distance. Rate here was much better than some of the rates I found for Dallas and Arlington.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great value

reviews.text: My second stay in two years for a conference. Marriott staff is extremely helpful and accomodating. Beautiful rooms, comfortable beds, excellent food. There is a spa within walking distance if you're interested in a manicure or pedicure.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable
Solid Business Hotel
reviews.text: Excellent hotel. I've stayed in plenty of Marriot's, but this is a bit above normal Marriot standards. Comfortable beds, nice views of the small lake, and great staff. It's a business hotel located in a business district. No restaurants within walking distance and the setting is basically high end office buildings in a very nice setting. I'm traveling on business and I'll be back.

Pretty standard Marriot. Soundproofing is an ISSUE. Moved rooms due to a very loud TV (could hear every word) but the front desk staff took care of this graciously and quickly. New Room, could still hear neighbours and hallway noise.
reviews.title: Standard, standard standard...loved the lake view

reviews.text: The hotel is pretty standard as far as Marriots go. Nothing screamed this place is special. Rooms pretty standard.
reviews.title: Not the best experience

reviews.text: Beautiful view of the lake. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Just Like New

reviews.text: We recently stayed at this Marriott for 4 nights for a Mom/Daughters college and shopping trip. This is a great hotel for business or leisure. The lobby and rooms are updated and clean. Check-in was a breeze and the pre-trip requests to the concierge for extra pillows and room service upon arrival were handled perfectly. We ordered room service several times and it was fresh, delicious and timely. One of the employees told me that Marriott had recently completed new beds and bedding in all there hotels worldwide. The beds were very comfortable and the linens and pillows were pristine. We had recently stay at a pricey hotel in Las Vegas with holes in the sheets and carpets so it was nice to be so impressed. The bathroom was clean and well-appointed. They have Bath and Body Works toiletries, which was a nice touch. There are no restuarants
reviews.title: Nice and Clean

likes.disliked: — front desk was unfriendly and bothered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: within walking distance but several are within a short drive. Our only complaint was that the front desk seemed bothered anytime we asked questions or advice. Overall, we were impressed and plan to stay here often
reviews.title: New property centrally located
Great hotel
reviews.text: while our daughter attends college in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Marriott Las Colinas in the City of Irving is a nicely appointed property located in a quickly growing upscale Dallas suburb.
reviews.title: Fantastic Beds, Very Nice!!

likes.disliked: — The bar and only one restaurant

reviews.title: Marriott Las Colinas
reviews.text: While the property was a little difficult to find at first, once we arrived check in was handled promptly and our request for a high floor King room located away from elevators/vending areas was granted without any fuss. Being a newer property, the lobby area sparkled, with a centrally located lounge, with a patio overlooking a water area. A small gift shop and hotel bistro restaurant were also located off the main lobby.

reviews.title: Best service ever!
reviews.text: Best service I've ever received in a hotel. Every staff member was extremely helpful and friendly. The room itself was very nice -- the usual big-Marriott standard. Good bar, good breakfast restaurant, decent room service. (The person who took my room service order actually spoke English.)

reviews.title: Great view-nice hotel
reviews.text: Wonderful view of Lake Carolyn and downtown Dallas at night. We sat in the window seat, admiring the view for hours, even though we have been to Dallas numerous times. Hotel staff were very effecient, but a little stuffy. The bed was like sleeping on a cloud!!!
